intro: Barneoudia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean barneoudia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy appearance with finely divided leaves. Its small, white or yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Barneoudia chilensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
